alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 1:51AM EDT until May 03 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Cumberland, Gloucester, and Salem. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 AM EDT, the stream gauge on the Maurice River at Norma was above flood stage. This is due to the 2.5 to 5 inches of rain that fell over the weekend. The gauge has crested and is falling but will remain above flood stage through Wednesday afternoon. - For Maurice River at Norma: At 1:15am the stage was 4.17 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
